SENT.plain: The cause of the enlarged head found in achondroplastic dwarfs has been disputed
We studied an infant achondroplastic dwarf who had an enlarged (90%) head at age 2 months without enlarged cerebral ventricles
At age 10 months, her head size further enlarged (95%) and the cerebral ventricles were dilated
Megalencephaly may be the major factor contributing to the enlarged head in newborn achondroplastic dwarfs
Later, enlarged cerebral ventricles also contribute
